intro: Erysimum persicum, commonly known as Persian winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed or heart-shaped. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in racemes, blooming in early spring. The plant is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
